item.title: Prerequisites
item.description:
Here are a few things you will need before starting the tutorial.

Building your website

  • Hugo installed on your machine (see this guide. The installation on Windows is tedious and the only way I could make it work was R > install package blogdown > blogdown::install_hugo() and manually add its path to the system environment variables.)
  • [optional] git installed on your machine (see this guide).

Hosting your website on GitHub

  • A GitHub account;
  • git installed on your machine (see this guide);
  • Basic git knowledge (clone, pull, add, commit and push). Note that most modern IDEs offer git support (or even git GUIs) so you may execute all those steps using an interface.

Hosting your website on UMich space

  • Access to the ITS Login Service
  • An IFS home directory
  • Request a directory
  • SSH command line or SFTP client (WinSCP for Windows)

MFile Web Hosting Tutorial from ITS

“http://www-personal.umich.edu/~youruniqname/"

WinSCP

login.itd.umich.edu

uniqname+password Check you have Public/html

Linux: simon@simon-pc:~/git/simfont$ scp -r simfont@login.itd.umich.edu:Public/html . Prompts Password. Then copy from server to you

other way around simon@simon-pc:~/git/simfont/html$ scp -r . simfont@login.itd.umich.edu:Public/html

“http://www.umich.edu/~groupname/"

item.title: GitHub Deployment
item.description:
change public to docs in config

publishDir = "docs"

change base url

baseurl = "https://your-github-account.github.io/academic-kickstart/"

git add -all git commit -m ‘First deploy’ git push

go to github go to academic kickstart settings scroll down to github pages source to master/docs

should be up in a few seconds!

Initialize and first deploy

say it is exactly what hugo academic suggests

fork to your github account (put link)

clone your own repo locally

git clone https://github.com/fontaine618/academic-kickstart.git DemoWebsite
cd DemoWebsite

import the academic theme

git submodule update

hugo
